reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Purely based on location you simply cannot get better in Ljubljana as the hotel was literally a 90 second walk to the centre of this wonderful and magical city. Of course ratings are comprised of much more than location and whilst the Emonec scored strongly in this section it faltered in others.
reviews.title: Cheap and Cheerful

reviews.text: Check in was a quick and easy affair and on first impressions we were pleasantly surpised with the look and layout of the room. On closer inspection though there were a few nagging annoyances that i feel could be improved at little cost. To begin with the beds were rock hard which played havoc on my ageing back. The dressing table had an annoying slope on it which irritated my girlfriend as things has a habit of sliding off!. The shower was similar to the type you get in Greece with a hand held shower and a partially covered shower curtain. This resulted in water getting everywhere in the bathroom that only dissipated when it was drained off. The AC was adeqaute on the whole but took ages to cool the room down to a sleepable temperature. Oh and as already highlighted by countless previous reviewers, the towels are literally hand towels!
reviews.title: In the middle of everything

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was ok i guess and whilst the choice was basic it was varied enough with a small selection of cold meats, cheese, bread, yoghurts, teas (good selection), coffees. Still, i think a few more basic things could have been added including more fruit and perhaps some tomatoes.
reviews.title: Very clean and perfect location

reviews.text: Staff were friendly and helpful enough.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ljubljana is a somewhat neglected and unchartered destination for many Brits and this i feel is a good thing and it avoided the hordes of football shirted tourists and the obiquitous stag do's that have degraded other Eastern European destinations. I totally fell in love with the place and Solvenia in general. The people are warm and friendly and should be very proud of the city and country as a whole. While it lacks traditional tourist sights the city wins with it's fairy tale looks and general joie de vivre and magical charm. If you get the chance hire some bikes and ride along the glorious river and up to Tivoli Park. Be brave and visit 'Hot 'n' Horse' at the park for a tasty Horseburger! At night the town comes alive with a host of bars and restaurants crammed into the banks of the river.
reviews.title: Basic hotel, excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is right in the heart of beautiful Ljubljana. It may look a little shabby outside; inside the rooms are simple but clean. The price included a breakfast. I recommend the place if you need a room for 1-2 nights and don't expect to pay for luxury.
reviews.title: Cheap hotel in the Centre of Ljubljana

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is the major selling point of this Hotel - a minute from the 3 bridges and barely 5 minutes from most other things of interest in central Ljubljana. It's also an easy 15 minute walk from the train/bus station.
reviews.title: Standard budget hotel with an A+ location

reviews.text: Otherwise it's a fairly standard budget Hotel - nothing particularly outstanding but certainly not uncomfortable. The room we had was a standard double, quite basic but spotlessly clean. The only real gripe we had was the lack of ammenity in the bathroom and the poor quality towels (very small). Overall, though, for the price and location it's fairly good value.
reviews.title: Great location and clean rooms, staff were utterly miserable!

reviews.text: Breakfast is a standard European buffet that is adequate, rather than especially good (have had better but also much, much worse). It doesn't include any hot food options.
reviews.title: Service with a Smile and a Location that makes you Smile

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We didn't have much cause to interact with the staff but they seemed friendly enough from the few queries we did have. There is an internet terminal in reception for those without their own device - unfortunately though it's not free.
reviews.title: Great location, OK to Good place

reviews.text: Booked two single rooms over Easter weekend. The hotel was in a fantastic location, we couldn't believe it when we arrived. Our single rooms had double beds and we very clean. The windows blocke out all noise when closed, not that there was much due to the fact that the hotel is off a pedestrian only main road. Would definitely recommend and would stay again!
reviews.title: Excellent location with great rooms

reviews.text: We (all 17 of us) used a lovely little hotel in this charming city for a stag doo
reviews.title: Average, but recommended.

reviews.text: Emonec is however, a great 2* Hotel for the following reasons:
reviews.title: central

reviews.text: I love this hotel. It's good value for money and is located very close to the city centre. The receptionist was always friendly, helpful and spoke fluent English. It would have been nice though if Internet access had been for free.
reviews.title: Hotel in the city centre

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here as two couples from March 1st-5th 2012. I was going to review this as 2/5 but you'll soon see why it only gets a 1/5...
reviews.title: One word -Avoid!

reviews.text: The location is fantastic, steps from all the main sights, really in the heart of the city. The rooms are big and the beds reasonably comfortable. The rooms are ensuite. The breakfast is a pretty good selection of cold meats, cheese, nice breads, teas, coffees and cereals. There is a safe in the room. The morning lady is pleasant and helpful.
reviews.title: Perfect Location for City Centre Ljubljana
